catalog_info.title: In and Out of Actions: An Introduction to Performance Art
catalog_info.notes: Interested students must attend first meeting of class during shopping week to speak with teaching staff about course enrollment procedure. Open to students of all levels. Interested students must attend first meeting of class during shopping week to speak with teaching staff about course enrollment procedure.
catalog_info.description: This course introduces students to the history and practice of performance art, social practice and event-based art making.  Starting with our own bodies, and working outward through texts, sites, histories, and fictions, we will complete short gestural exercises, write and interpret scores, and develop situation-specific projects.  This course will introduce movements and artists including the Futurists, Black Mountain College, Allan Kaprow, the Gutai Group, Womanhouse, and many more. Experimentation, collaboration, and participation will be encouraged.
